lead_paragraph: In most ways, Medicaid offers an excellent return on investment, but 19 states have refused to participate in the expansion.

byline.contributor: Aaron E. Carroll is a professor of pediatrics at Indiana University School of Medicine who blogs on health research and policy at The Incidental Economist and makes videos at Healthcare Triage. Follow him on Twitter at @aaronecarroll.

headline.print_headline: How the Expansion of Medicaid Partly Pays for Itself
headline.main: It’s Easy for Obamacare Critics to Overlook the Merits of Medicaid Expansion

snippet: In most ways, Medicaid offers an excellent return on investment, but 19 states have refused to participate in the expansion....
abstract:
The Upshot; research suggests that Medicaid expansion positively impacts access to care and
utilization of health care services.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
